Ischemia refers to a condition of insufficient blood supply to an organ or tissue, leading to a lack of oxygen and nutrients. Reperfusion injury, on the other hand, is the damage that occurs when blood flow is restored to an ischemic tissue, due to the reintroduction of oxygen and various reactive oxygen species.
